page.title: 03FARMING 1
page.content: Mr. Clark of Moulton has 225 acres and 400 sheep. His two breeds are Southdown and Suffolk Cross. He has lived there for 28.5 years and owns one welsh sheep dog called Lee. He grows barley, wheat and peas and sells most of his crops. The land in this are is quite light. He feeds his animals on hay, turnips and concentrates. He gets up to feed the animals at six thirty every morning. Nearly every year he has Lamb Sunday, when people come and see the lambs. He works even on a Sunday and has one farm worker to help him and his son-in-law and daughter as well. He now lives in an old barn which he had renovated; but he landscaped the garden himself.
